org.xlattice.transport.tcp

Class SchedulableTcpConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xlattice.transport.tcp.SchedulableTcpConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.xlattice.Connection, SchedulableConnection

    public class SchedulableTcpConnection
extends java.lang.Object
implements SchedulableConnection
    This implementation restricts a connection to having only one SelectionKey and only one IOScheduler. This does not seem to be unreasonable.
    Author:
    Jim Dixon

      • initiateReading

        public void initiateReading()
        Description copied from interface: SchedulableConnection
        Called by the ConnectionListener (or assignee) to signal that it is prepared to receive data. Reading should be enabled on the connection's SelectionKey and any data in the input buffer should be processed just as when readyToRead() has been called. The ConnectionListener may delegate responsibility for making this call to another program component, the assignee.
        Specified by:
        initiateReading in interface SchedulableConnection

      • sendData

        public void sendData(java.nio.ByteBuffer outBuffer)
        Description copied from interface: SchedulableConnection
        Called by the ConnectionListener or assignee to initiate the sending of data.
        Specified by:
        sendData in interface SchedulableConnection
        Parameters:
        outBuffer - holds data to be transmitted

      • readyToRead

        public void readyToRead()
        Description copied from interface: SchedulableConnection
        Called by the IOScheduler when data has been received, that is, when an isReadable() SelectionKey has been received. The input buffer is checked. If a read returns -1, the connection has been closed and the ConnectionListener's reportDisconnect() method should be called. If the read returns 0, the call should be silently ignored. Any other read value should result in a call to the listener's dataReceived() method.
        Specified by:
        readyToRead in interface SchedulableConnection

      • readyToWrite

        public void readyToWrite()
        Description copied from interface: SchedulableConnection
        Called by the IOScheduler when data can be written, that is, when an isWritable() SelectionKey has been received. Any data in the output buffer is written to the connection's channel. If the write does not empty the output buffer, the connection waits for another readyToWrite. If the write empties the output buffer, the listener is signaled using its dataSent() method. The listener then may disable writing.
        Specified by:
        readyToWrite in interface SchedulableConnection
